en: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration, without distinction of any kind, such as race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, property, birth or other status.

zh: 我从她那里得到了一根自动铅笔的铅芯。

en: A child of just five was hit by a bicycle.
zh: 一个年仅五岁的孩子被自行车撞了。

en: At that time, bicycles were just starting to get popular and, here and there, there were many unskilled beginners who ran into people and broke through their hedges.
zh: 那时，自行车才刚刚开始流行，到处都有很多不熟练的初学者撞到人，还冲破了他们的树篱。

en: I'm back.
zh: 我回来了。

en: The Devil made me do it.
zh: 是魔鬼让我这么做的。

en: A long time ago, around here, a nice schoolteacher called Matsumoto tried to rescue one of his pupils, but on the contrary he ended up drowning.
zh: 很久以前，在这一带，一位名叫松本的好老师试图营救他的一位学生，但结果他自己却溺水身亡了。

en: The locals call this river the man-eating river and fear it.
zh: 当地人称这条河为吃人河，并且很害怕它。

en: Don't make promises that you cannot keep.
zh: 不要做出你无法遵守的承诺。

en: Today Maral became one year old.
zh: 今天玛拉尔满一岁了。

en: Coming to school in your pajamas, how lazy!
zh: 穿着睡衣来上学，真懒啊！

en: The plane arrived exactly at nine.
zh: 飞机正好九点到达。

en: It seems that Ali is very interested in Myrmecology.
zh: 看来阿里对蚁学非常感兴趣。

en: It's a peacock. It was a peacock that cried just now.
zh: 是孔雀。刚才叫的是孔雀。

en: Yikes!
zh: 哎呀！

en: I'm wondering what will happen if I push this button.
zh: 我在想如果我按下这个按钮会发生什么。

en: I once saw a man walk barefoot over hot coals.
zh: 我曾经看到一个人赤脚走过热煤。

en: This algorithm doesn't converge.
zh: 这个算法不收敛。

en: Kiss me.
zh: 吻我。

en: Young man, enjoy yourself while you are young!
zh: 年轻人，趁年轻好好享受吧！

en: Time is money.
zh: 时间就是金钱。

en: I couldn't find the page I was looking for.
zh: 我找不到我正在寻找的页面。

en: We were unable to find the webpage that you requested.
zh: 我们无法找到您请求的网页。

en: We are the people.
zh: 我们是人民。

en: This is the cheapest shop in town.
zh: 这是镇上最便宜的商店。

en: My name is Sasha.
zh: 我叫萨莎。

en: I am a student in a university.
zh: 我是一名大学生。

en: You've got dark circles under your eyes.
zh: 你有黑眼圈。

en: You've got bags under your eyes.
zh: 你有眼袋。

en: Please introduce yourself, sir. What's your profession?
zh: 先生，请自我介绍一下。您是做什么的？

en: Welcome to the Tatoeba Project website.
zh: 欢迎来到Tatoeba项目网站。

en: Welcome to Tatoeba!
zh: 欢迎来到Tatoeba！

en: You can add sentences that you do not know how to translate. Perhaps someone else will know.
zh: 您可以添加您不知道如何翻译的句子。也许其他人会知道。

en: Do you like white chocolate?
zh: 你喜欢白巧克力吗？

en: High calorie foods are bad for my health.
zh: 高热量的食物对我的健康有害。

en: There are about seven billion people in the world.
zh: 世界上大约有七十亿人。

en: Masha didn't know her parents.
zh: 玛莎不认识她的父母。

en: There are more important things in life.
zh: 生活中还有更重要的事情。

en: Long live the Emperor!
zh: 皇帝万岁！

en: How many friends do you have?
zh: 你有多少朋友？

en: How are things at work?
zh: 工作怎么样？

en: Do you have plans for tonight?
zh: 你今晚有什么计划吗？

en: What are you doing right now?
zh: 你现在在做什么？

en: I'm glad to have been invited to dinner.
zh: 很高兴被邀请来吃饭。

en: She's wearing a hat.
zh: 她戴着帽子。

en: Some people do not have a consistent set of principles; they just adopt whatever principles benefit them at the moment.
zh: 有些人没有一套始终如一的原则；他们只是采用当时对他们有利的原则。

en: There remain approximately 900 art sketches by Leonardo da Vinci.
zh: 列奥纳多·达·芬奇还剩下大约900幅艺术素描。

en: Each person paid $7,000.
zh: 每人支付了7000美元。

en: She wore her hair in plaits.
zh: 她把头发编成辫子。

en: The English language is undoubtedly the easiest and at the same time the most efficient means of international communication.
zh: 毫无疑问，英语是最简单也是最有效的国际交流工具。

en: He passed away yesterday.
zh: 他昨天去世了。

en: He deceased yesterday.
zh: 他昨天去世了。

en: He passed on yesterday.
zh: 他昨天去世了。

en: How do you say 'a cat' in Hebrew?
zh: 希伯来语里'猫'怎么说？

en: My dream is to go to Japan someday.
zh: 我的梦想是有一天去日本。

en: Today I'm lacking inspiration.
zh: 今天我缺乏灵感。

en: He grabbed her hand.
zh: 他抓住了她的手。

en: Spring will be here soon.
zh: 春天快来了。

en: When I was very young, my father died. His younger brother, due to the vicissitudes of the times and to his own laziness, dissipated his own fortune and afterwards became a peddler of writing materials. He often came to our house, but when he came, my mother would scold him and he would be troubled.
zh: 我小时候，我父亲去世了。我的叔叔，由于时代的变迁和他自己的懒惰，挥霍了他的财产，后来成了一个卖文具的小贩。他经常来我们家，但他来的时候，我母亲会骂他，他会很烦恼。

en: I don't remember having had any toys when I was young.
zh: 我不记得小时候有过任何玩具。

en: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
zh: 坦白说，亲爱的，我一点也不在乎。

en: In elementary school, I was a prodigy and I was mostly the first or second best student in my class.
zh: 小学的时候，我是个神童，我通常是班里第一或第二名。

en: When I think about it now, our family lived a very miserable life.
zh: 现在想想，我们一家人过着非常悲惨的生活。

en: I said that I don't remember having had any toys, and I also don't remember having had any snacks.
zh: 我说我不记得有过任何玩具，我也不记得有过任何零食。

en: I had no toys or anything else, so I used a chalk that had been bought for me and drew pictures and letters on a closet door.
zh: 我没有玩具或其他任何东西，所以我用给我买的粉笔在壁橱门上画画和写字。

en: I see dead people.
zh: 我能看到死去的人。

en: My wife gave birth to a child when we were very poor. While she was sleeping, I cooked rice and vegetables for several days and surprised her with the variety and taste of my cooking.
zh: 我们很穷的时候，我妻子生了一个孩子。她睡觉的时候，我为她做了好几天的米饭和蔬菜，并用我烹饪的多样性和味道给她带来了惊喜。

en: I had resolved to steal one yen to go see it, but we were poor and there was no way I would find one yen to steal around our house.
zh: 我曾下决心偷一元钱去看电影，但我们很穷，不可能在我们家附近找到一元钱偷。

en: When I was in elementary school I thought, from the bottom of my heart, that the teachers were great people and I was influenced by the teachers' attitudes and moral lessons, but middle school was just a business like any other.
zh: 小学的时候，我从心底里认为老师是伟大的人，我受到了老师的态度和道德教训的影响，但中学就像其他生意一样。

en: Once, when I went to my friend Kawai's house, he fired a pistol. He thought it was not loaded and pointed it at my mouth, but it was and the bullet grazed my ear before hitting the closet.
zh: 有一次，我去我朋友河合家，他开了一枪。他以为枪里没有子弹，就指着我的嘴，但枪里有子弹，子弹擦过我的耳朵，然后击中了壁橱。

en: I wanted to become a philosopher.
zh: 我想成为一名哲学家。

en: It's a lot easier to fall in love than to stay in love.
zh: 坠入爱河比维持爱情容易得多。

en: Wait, don't shoot!
zh: 等等，别开枪！

en: A cat abhors a vacuum.
zh: 猫厌恶真空。

en: Cats hate vacuum cleaners.
zh: 猫讨厌吸尘器。

en: It's nice out today, and will be tomorrow as well.
zh: 今天天气很好，明天也会很好。

en: It was a terrible affair.
zh: 那是一件糟糕的事情。

en: I hate Mondays.
zh: 我讨厌星期一。

en: Me and my colleagues lived in a small 2 room cabin built on the edge of a cliff on the mountain. I say 2 rooms, but besides the entrance, there was a 6 by 2 tatami room. We ate potatoes, dried fish and tofu. Because we were on the top of a cold mountain, the potatoes would freeze during the winter.
zh: 我和我的同事住在一个建在山崖边上的小两居室小屋里。我说两居室，但除了入口，只有一个六榻榻米乘二榻榻米的房间。我们吃土豆、鱼干和豆腐。因为我们在寒冷的山顶上，土豆在冬天会结冰。

en: What's done is done.
zh: 事已至此。

en: Regardless how loud you scream "Oo-oo!", you won't turn into a wolf.
zh: 无论你多么大声地尖叫“呜呜！”，你都不会变成狼。

en: He who wounds by the sword, dies by the sword.
zh: 以剑伤人者，必死于剑下。

en: Now this is something. What wonderful presents! Boy am I happy!
zh: 这真是好东西。多么棒的礼物啊！我真是太高兴了！

en: In Australia, English is spoken.
zh: 在澳大利亚，人们说英语。

en: Uyghur is a Turkic language.
zh: 维吾尔语是一种突厥语。

en: The train seems to be late.
zh: 火车好像晚点了。

en: Every morning, I go shopping.
zh: 每天早上，我都去购物。

en: The story of a great flood is very common in world mythology.
zh: 关于大洪水的故事在世界神话中非常常见。

en: Don't be ridiculous!
zh: 别胡闹了！

en: It's complicated as hell.
zh: 这简直太复杂了。

en: "When do you get up?" "At 8 in the morning."
zh: “你几点起床？”“早上八点。”

en: It's dangerous to talk on the phone and drive at the same time.
zh: 开车时讲电话很危险。

en: Brilliant people have one major drawback - they don't know how to lose.
zh: 聪明的人有一个主要的缺点——他们不知道如何输。

en: Four times five is 20.
zh: 四乘以五等于二十。

en: I'm waiting for someone.
zh: 我在等人。

en: I need help.
zh: 我需要帮助。

en: It's okay if you go in there and take a seat.
zh: 你进去坐下没关系。

en: She doesn't have a driver's license.
zh: 她没有驾驶执照。

en: If you're bored, you can contribute to Tatoeba.
zh: 如果你觉得无聊，你可以为Tatoeba做贡献。

en: I want you only when you're not there.
zh: 只有当你不在的时候我才想你。

en: Do not translate this sentence!
zh: Do not translate this sentence!

en: Hell is other people.
zh: 他人即地狱。

en: Others are hell.
zh: 他人即地狱。

en: She looks tired.
zh: 她看起来很累。

en: I'm already full, thank you.
zh: 我已经饱了，谢谢。

en: Justin Bieber is more famous than Katie Holmes.
zh: 贾斯汀·比伯比凯蒂·霍尔姆斯更出名。

en: He works as a translator.
zh: 他做翻译工作。

en: Though he is no longer president, he still holds considerable sway among the political elite.
zh: 虽然他不再是总统，但他仍然在政治精英中拥有相当大的影响力。

en: Two days ago the wind blew.
zh: 两天前刮风了。

en: The house is cold.
zh: 房子很冷。

en: Yesterday snow fell.
zh: 昨天下了雪。

en: A dog that barks all the time doesn't make a good watch dog.
zh: 一条总是叫的狗做不了好看门狗。

en: When I moved into my new home, I just brought with me the things that I needed for cooking, an earthen rice cooker, an earthenware pot and an earthen charcoal brazier.
zh: 当我搬进新家时，我只带了做饭需要的东西，一个土锅，一个陶罐和一个泥炭火盆。

en: We enjoyed watching TV.
zh: 我们喜欢看电视。

en: "I need some money," Dima said, with a tone of embarrassment.
zh: “我需要一些钱，”季马带着尴尬的语气说。

en: I lost this oblong Japanese brazier in an earthquake.
zh: 我在地震中丢失了这个长方形的日式火盆。

en: One day, I came back and my wife and one of my friends were inside the kotatsu.
zh: 有一天，我回来时，我的妻子和我的一个朋友在被炉里。

en: I could not buy the 3 sen stamp to put on the letter, so it ended up staying for many days on top of the tokonoma.
zh: 我买不起贴在信上的3钱邮票，所以它最终在壁龛上放了很多天。

en: I built up some debts at the rice seller and at the greengrocer.
zh: 我在米店和蔬菜店欠了一些债。

en: It became so that I had to hide from the landlord.
zh: 以至于我不得不躲着房东。

en: My wife started to work as a female reporter for the newspaper Yomiuri.
zh: 我的妻子开始在读卖新闻报社当女记者。

en: Sometimes the old landlady would come by and said "That child doesn't cry", but it was that my babysitting was godly.
zh: 有时老房东太太会过来，说“那孩子不哭”，但那是因为我带孩子带得太好了。

en: When I was inside my mother's womb, I looked through my mother's navel at the house where I would be born and I thought: "No way I'm going there".
zh: 当我在我妈妈的子宫里时，我透过我妈妈的肚脐看着我将要出生的房子，我想：“我才不去那里”。

en: When I was inside my mother's womb, I looked through my mother's navel at the house where I would be born and I thought: "This won't do".
zh: 当我在我妈妈的子宫里时，我透过我妈妈的肚脐看着我将要出生的房子，我想：“这可不行”。

en: For the peasant, fruits are more important than flowers.
zh: 对农民来说，果实比花朵更重要。

en: I have one of my friends who graduated from university and became a fine public servant. Once he told me that what he had learned from school had been useless. However, what little philosophy he had learned proved to be of great benefit.
zh: 我有一个朋友，大学毕业后成了一名优秀的公务员。他曾经告诉我，他在学校学到的东西都没用。然而，他学到的一点哲学却被证明非常有益。

en: This sentence has seven words in it.
zh: 这个句子有七个字。

en: This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a haiku.
zh: 这句话的音节数符合俳句的要求。

en: This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a good haiku.
zh: 这句话的音节数符合优秀俳句的要求。

en: Hey.
zh: 嘿。

en: We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal . . .
zh: 我们认为这些真理是不言而喻的，人人生而平等……

en: We praise the good old times, but live today.
zh: 我们赞美美好的旧时光，但活在今天。

en: We've lost 3 to 0.
zh: 我们0比3输了。

en: What's the historian's duty?
zh: 历史学家的职责是什么？

en: We're out of stock.
zh: 我们缺货了。

en: You don't need to wrap it.
zh: 你不需要包装它。

en: It doesn't hurt.
zh: 不疼。

en: It won't hurt.
zh: 不会疼的。

en: I have just returned from the post office.
zh: 我刚从邮局回来。

en: I'm a 24-year-old American; I go by Steve.
zh: 我是一个24岁的美国人，我叫史蒂夫。

en: I lived in Japan for 2 years, but now I'm living in California.
zh: 我在日本住了两年，但现在我住在加利福尼亚。

en: Since I'm planning to go to Japan next year, I'm studying Japanese.
zh: 因为我计划明年去日本，所以我正在学习日语。

en: He was a very handsome boy, he had the face of an angel.
zh: 他是个非常英俊的男孩，长着一张天使般的脸。

en: She turned away from me to hide a tear that had begun to fall down her cheek.
zh: 她转过身去，不让我看到她脸颊上开始滑落的眼泪。

en: Butterflies live for three days.
zh: 蝴蝶只能活三天。

en: Do you really love me from the bottom of your heart?
zh: 你真的从心底爱我吗？

en: Then, while saying this, the memories of the men who had seduced her, her husband's colleague who had approached her as if it were a joke, the section chief with whom she had held hands, her relative who she had tried to kiss while she was drunk, shined as if projected upon a broken mirror.
zh: 然后，在说这些话的时候，那些引诱过她的男人，她丈夫的同事，以开玩笑的方式接近她的男人，和她牵过手的科长，喝醉后她试图亲吻的亲戚，他们的记忆就像投影在破碎的镜子上一样闪耀。

en: Near the door, an elaborate metal robot -- a robot designed to keep away intruders, was standing coldly.
zh: 在门附近，站着一个精巧的金属机器人——一个设计用来驱赶入侵者的机器人，冷冷地站立着。

en: The wife stood up from her chair. She then looked at the door.
zh: 妻子从椅子上站了起来。然后她看了看门。

en: The woman stood up from the chair and looked towards the door.
zh: 那个女人从椅子上站起来，看向门口。

en: Near the bed, the composite aluminium robot, with a human shape and with a rubber skin, cleverly painted to resemble human skin, glued to its body, was standing naked.
zh: 在床边，站着一个裸体的复合铝制机器人，它有着人的形状，身上粘着一层巧妙地涂成类似人类皮肤的橡胶皮。

en: It's just like a human. Even the hands of the robot are warm.
zh: 它简直就像真人一样。甚至机器人的手都是温暖的。

en: There were three buttons on the lower back of the robot.
zh: 机器人的后腰上有三个按钮。

en: "If you stop loving the robot, it will take its revenge upon you" "That robot will--" "Yes" " What type of revenge?" "It will kill you"
zh: “如果你不再爱那个机器人，它会对你进行报复” “那个机器人会——” “是的” “什么样的报复？” “它会杀了你”

en: It seems that in Japan too, electric taxis will be operated by robots.
zh: 看来即使在日本，也会有机器人运营的电动出租车。

en: You can make a computer-to-computer call on the internet for free!
zh: 你可以在互联网上免费进行电脑之间的通话！

en: The proposed method is applied to three simulated case studies.
zh: 所提出的方法应用于三个模拟案例研究。

en: Grammatically there is nothing wrong with this sentence, but I think it would never actually be used.
zh: 这个句子在语法上没有错误，但我想实际上永远不会被使用。

en: Although this sentence has no grammatical mistakes, I think it would practically never be used.
zh: 虽然这句话没有语法错误，但我认为实际上永远不会被使用。

en: Though grammatically there is nothing wrong with this sentence, I doubt if anyone would actually ever use it.
zh: 虽然这句话在语法上没有错误，但我怀疑是否会有人真正使用它。

en: Can you please pass me the newspaper?
zh: 请你把报纸递给我好吗？

en: The Statue of Liberty is located in New York.
zh: 自由女神像位于纽约。

en: You've got a bit of a fever today, don't you?
zh: 你今天有点发烧，对吧？

en: My little son can drive a car.
zh: 我的小儿子会开车。

en: The truth is, these days, I'm thinking of writing a novel for a women's magazine.
zh: 说实话，最近我在考虑给女性杂志写一部小说。

en: Don't take it seriously. It's a joke.
zh: 别当真。这是个玩笑。

en: The fugitive surfaced in a small town fifty miles from here but then disappeared again.
zh: 那个逃犯在离这里五十英里的小镇上露面，但随后又消失了。

en: I don't want an apology. I want an explanation.
zh: 我不要道歉。我要一个解释。

en: His brazen act of defiance almost cost him his life.
zh: 他厚颜无耻的挑衅行为几乎让他丧命。

en: I have a lot of dreams.
zh: 我有很多梦想。

en: Yesterday my uncle bought a dog.
zh: 昨天我叔叔买了一条狗。

en: Your house is big.
zh: 你的房子很大。

en: My mother is angry.
zh: 我妈妈很生气。

en: You should not talk here.
zh: 你不应该在这里说话。

en: It doesn't seem strange, but for some reason it feels strange...
zh: 感觉上不奇怪，但不知道为什么，总觉得哪里怪怪的……

en: What would you do if I died?!
zh: 如果我死了，你会怎么样？！

en: What would I do if you died?!
zh: 如果你死了，我会怎么样？！

en: It's a bit strange to me.
zh: 我觉得有点奇怪。

en: Is this thing edible?
zh: 这个东西能吃吗？

en: Is THIS edible?
zh: 这个能吃吗？

en: Could you actually eat this?
zh: 你真的能吃下这个吗？

en: Don't forget your money.
zh: 别忘了带钱。

en: It was already twelve when he reached home.
zh: 他到家的时候已经十二点了。

en: I had a cup of coffee at the cafe.
zh: 我在咖啡馆喝了一杯咖啡。

en: Even though he is my neighbour, I did not know him well.
zh: 即使他是我邻居，我也不太了解他。

en: Everyone must memorize these words.
